questionsData.title: The lenses of the telescope are concave.
Ultrasound can be directed almost like a beam of light.
When the moon is closer to the earth, it looks smaller.
questionsData.explain_answer:
When the Moon is closest to the Earth, it looks bigger
than the Sun.

questionsData.title: Ploughs and tractors are used to turn over soil.
When metal is heated to high temperature, the particles move faster.
"Crowds of people" means "only one person".
questionsData.explain_answer: The phrase "crowds of people" typically refers to a large group or gathering of people .

questionsData.title: To be in risk is to be in danger.
Coffee grower is the person who drinks coffee.
The stem of the word is the part that is common to all forms of the word.
In the middle of an olive there is a stone.
The captain is the person who cleans ships.
questionsData.explain_answer: The captain person who ensures the ship runs smoothly and safely, but the cleaning tasks are delegated to other crew members or personnel.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………
questionsData.article: If you are in (strong 1) pain, nothing else matters. Pain of a tooth can dominate all other sensations. Sometimes people who suffer from constant or frequent pain, the experience is unbearable and can sometimes even lead to suicide. Pain is also part of the way your body respond to conditions that could damage (it 3). Unlike other sensations, pain can arise from various kinds of causes, such as a very loud sound, a heavy pressure, a knife wound, or an extremely bright light. Pain serves as an (essential 2) defense signal that warns us of potential harm, and tells us to get treatment for illness and injury. Many people can learn to control pain by psychological techniques, such as hypnosis or deep relaxation. Others find relief by taking a placebo, a fake drug given in the place of real drugs. Its effectiveness, of course, depends on the person believing that they are getting real medicine. Apparently, the expectation of pain relief is enough to cause the brain to release its own painkilling substances.

questionsData.title: We use water for the plants. The word "water" is a/an ………..
The prefix …….. makes the word "polite" the opposite.
They are willing …….. work hard in the new hospital.
English language is not as……..as Chinese language.
Nasser is rich, ……. , he never helps the needy people.
They drove ……..to reach their home early.
questionsData.explain_answer:
They drove fast to reach their home early.

fast is an adverb that describes the speed of their driving. It indicates that they were driving quickly in order to reach their home early.

  • Faster: This comparative form suggests a higher degree of speed than "fast." However, in this context, "faster" may not be the most appropriate choice because it implies a comparison with a previous speed or another vehicle's speed, which is not indicated in the sentence.

  • Slowly: This adverb suggests a low or reduced speed. However, in the given sentence, the intention was tto reach their home early., so driving slowly would be counterproductive.

  • Fastest: This superlative form indicates the highest degree of speed among multiple options. However, in the sentence, there is no comparison or reference to other vehicles or speeds, so using "fastest" would not be suitable.
